p: Furthermore, indirect effects are involved in the immunomodulatory properties of polysaccharides. In particular, dietary fibers (e.g., inulin, mannan, β-glucan, pectin) are metabolized by intestinal bacteria in the anaerobic environment of the cecum and colon, so generating SCFA, such as acetate, propionate and butyrate [ 126]. These molecules are able to cross the gut epithelium and interact with surface receptors on the immune cells, such as the G-protein coupled receptors (GPRs) 41 and 43 [ 127]. The activation of GPRs by SCFA modulates inflammatory signalling pathways, such as NF-κB, ERK and p38 MAPK [ 128, 129].
